episodes.title: 106: Taste of Persia
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: Naomi Duguid discovers the backstreet cooking of Armenia, Georgia and Iran; plus we learn a better way to make stew; Fuchsia Dunlop joins us live at Milk Street; The New Yorker’s Adam Gopnik discusses ethical eating; and we take your calls with Sara Moulton. (Originally aired 11/26/2016, Available for Re-run 3/2/17 – 3/9/17)

episodes.title: 116: Vikram and Meeru’s Excellent Restaurant Adventure
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week, the new Indian cooking with Meeru Dhalwala and Vikram Vij, hunting to eat with Louise Gray, Dan Pashman of WNYC’s The Sporkful podcast plays with breakfast cereal, and our recipe for creamy pasta sauce.

episodes.title: 115: Eat, Cook, Love in Senegal
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week, we talk to chef Pierre Thiam. The food of Senegal has big flavors and big heart, and Thiam reveals the culture that inspired him to cook. “In Senegal … people believe that the more they share the food with you, the more plentiful their bowl will be,” he says. Then we’ll present our … Continue reading "115: Eat, Cook, Love in Senegal"

episodes.title: 114: Dorie’s Cookies
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, master baker Dorie Greenspan remembers her experiences with Julia Child. “When I first met Julia she said… ‘Have you ever seen the Dan Aykroyd Saturday Night Live skit? You know, where Dan Aykroyd imitates me?’ She stood up and did the entire routine, so I got to watch Julia … Continue reading "114: Dorie’s Cookies"

episodes.title: 104: Nigella Bites Back
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we get up close and personal with Nigella Lawson. “You know the whole guilt thing I never quite get,” says Lawson. “One of the things I’m asked most often when I’m interviewed is, ‘What is your guilty pleasure?’ And I get rather prissy and I always say to everyone, … Continue reading "104: Nigella Bites Back"

episodes.title: 113: The Simple Kitchen
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, British writer Diana Henry, author of “Simple”, redefines home cooking and recalls an early memory at her parents’ home in Ireland. “I was probably about 9 and they had a big party,” Henry says. “It was a rainy night in autumn or winter in Northern Ireland. They put Frank … Continue reading "113: The Simple Kitchen"

episodes.title: 112: Saffron Tales
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio,Yasmin Khan gives us a closer look at Iranian food and her personal journey with it. “I think saffron probably for me is the most evocative of all Iranian spices,” says Khan. “It has a very special kind of place in the Iranian home. I had a really wonderful experience … Continue reading "112: Saffron Tales"

episodes.title: 111: The Joy of Turkish Cooking
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, chef Ana Sortun unveils the secrets of Turkish cooking. “I think the very first time I went to Turkey, I was invited to go study with a couple of women. One lived in the southeast of Turkey, and she organized a potluck that was put on by her friends … Continue reading "111: The Joy of Turkish Cooking"

episodes.title: 110: 48 Hours With Andy Ricker In Thailand
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we speak with Andy Ricker (Pok Pok) in Chiang Mai, Thailand. “Western food … builds flavor over time to come up with a monolithic, single, strong, rich flavor,” Ricker says. “Thai food and southeast Asian food, in general, tends to be this battle of different bright, salty, sweet, sour, … Continue reading "110: 48 Hours With Andy Ricker In Thailand"

episodes.title: 109: Ziggy Marley Stirs It Up
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we interview Ziggy Marley about his new cookbook. “For me, the most special moments is when it comes from the place that you can’t explain. A lot of my songs, the one’s that … give me that other worldly experience, I can’t explain how they came,” Marley says. “Those … Continue reading "109: Ziggy Marley Stirs It Up"

episodes.title: 102: The Baking Revolution
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we visit Claire Ptak of Violet Bakery in London. Claire says under-beat, under-fold and under-bake; plus we’ll give you our take on chocolate, prune and rum cake; Dan Pashman of the Sporkful talks about the science of snacks; New Yorker writer Adam Gopnik breaks down his perspective on cultural … Continue reading "102: The Baking Revolution"

episodes.title: 108: Cooking the United Nations
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we talk to blogger and writer Sasha Martin, who cooks through the alphabet starting with Afghanistan. “The first day we meet, the next day we are brothers,” Sasha says. “And this idea that when we sit down to the food and we put away our silverware and we’re eating … Continue reading "108: Cooking the United Nations"

episodes.title: 107: Michael Pollan Speaks Out
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we talk with food writer Michael Pollan—author of The Omnivore’s Dilemma and star of the Netflix series “Cooked.” “I don’t think people are quite aware how many marketing messages for food they see in a day,” Pollan says. “The total amount of money the government spends offering nutrition advice, … Continue reading "107: Michael Pollan Speaks Out"

episodes.title: 101: Good Morning Vietnam
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we take a look inside the Vietnamese kitchen and talk to Andrea Nguyen about everything from breakfast banh mi to “kheo.” “I think authenticity comes from the ability to cook well and to cook with intent,” Nguyen says. “We describe good cooking, thoughtful cooking, as cooking that is kheo.” … Continue reading "101: Good Morning Vietnam"

episodes.title: 106: Taste of Persia
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week on Milk Street Radio, we discover the backstreet cooking of Armenia, Georgia and Iran with Naomi DuGuid: “We sit and sip tea together. That’s just magical — you know we don’t have a language, but we’re so appreciating that moment… there’s just this feeling… it’s a huge world but we can hold hands … Continue reading "106: Taste of Persia"

episodes.title: 105: What A Fish Knows
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week, we interview Jonathan Balcombe, author of the book What A Fish Knows; we send our intrepid reporter Olivia Humphreys to London where she removes her inhibitions and her clothes to report on the latest “naked pop-up;” we’ll give you our recipe for a no-brine turkey; The Sporkful’s Dan Pashman explores a vegetarian Thanksgiving; … Continue reading "105: What A Fish Knows"

episodes.title: 104: Nigella Bites Back
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week we get up close and personal with Nigella Lawson; plus quick Tuesday night meals with Lidia Bastianich; a revolutionary approach to foolproof pie dough; we’ll talk to Stephanie Danler, author of the novel Sweetbitter; and we take your calls with Sara Moulton.

episodes.title: 103: The Pollen Detective
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: This week, we learn how pollen analysis is used to foil honey laundering and solve cold murder cases; plus our Chinese white-cooked chicken recipe; chef Andy Ricker’s favorite kitchen tools; we take your calls with Sara Moulton; wine expert Stephen Meuse offers insight on dry Rieslings; and the strange science of marinades.

episodes.title: 102: The Baking Revolution
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: Claire Ptak of Violet Bakery in London says under-beat, under-fold and under-bake; plus chocolate, prune and rum cake with Rayna Jhaveri, Dan Pashman of The Sporkful on the science of snacks; Adam Gopnik of The New Yorker on cultural appropriation; and the best way to beat egg whites.

episodes.title: 101: Good Morning Vietnam
episodes.author: Christopher Kimball's Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: Inside the Vietnamese kitchen from breakfast banh mi to kheo, or cooking with intent; plus unscrambling eggs; visiting a thriving Syrian refugee camp bakery; and rethinking nonstick pans.

episodes.title: Introducing Christopher Kimball’s Milk Street Radio
episodes.author: Milk Street Radio
episodes.summary: Welcome to Christopher Kimball’s Milk Street Radio! From street food in Thailand to a bakery in a Syrian refugee camp to how one scientist uses uses state of the art pollen analysis to track the origins of honey (and also to solve cold murder cases), Christopher Kimball’s Milk Street Radio goes anywhere and everywhere to … Continue reading "Introducing Christopher Kimball’s Milk Street Radio"
